analyzed: milindapañha

original: Opammakathāpañha🔽Sīhavagga
analyzed: opamma kathā pañha  sīha vagga

original: 1. Sīhaṅgapañha
analyzed: sīhaṅgapañha
translated: The Questions of Siha

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘sīhassa satta aṅgāni gahetabbānī’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamāni tāni satta aṅgāni gahetabbānī”ti?
analyzed: bhante nāgasena sīhassa satta aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti yam vadesi katamāni tāni satta aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say that seven factors of the lion should be taken up, which are these seven factors that should be taken up?”

original: “Yathā, mahārāja, sīho nāma setavimalaparisuddhapaṇḍaro;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja sīhaḥ nāma seta vimala parisuddha paṇḍaraḥ
translated: “As, sire, the lion is pure white, spotless, and clean,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena setavimalaparisuddhapaṇḍaracittena byapagatakukkuccena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena seta vimala parisuddha paṇḍara cittena byapagata kukkuccena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be one whose mind is pure white, spotless, and clean, and who is free from scruples.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa paṭhamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja sīhassa paṭhamam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the first factor of the lion that should be taken up.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sīho catucaraṇo vikkantacārī;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sīhaḥ catu caraṇaḥ vikkanta cārī
translated: “And again, sire, the lion is one who walks with four feet, and walks with a stride;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena caturiddhipādacaraṇena bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena catur iddhipāda caraṇena
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be one who walks with the four feet of psychic power.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa dutiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja sīhassa dutiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the second factor of the lion that should be taken up.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sīho abhirūparucirakesarī;
analyzed: punar capara mahā rāja sīhaḥ abhirūpa rucira kesarī
translated: “And again, sire, the lion has a beautiful and lovely mane;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena abhirūparucirasīlakesarinā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena abhirūpa rucira sīla kesarinā
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be beautiful, lovely, and resplendent.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa tatiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja sīhassa tatiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the third quality of the lion that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sīho jīvitapariyādānepi na kassaci onamati;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sīhaḥ jīvita pariyādāne pi na kassaci onamati
translated: “And again, sire, when the lion is about to die he does not bow down to anyone;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānapaccayabhesajjaparikkhārapariyādānepi na kassaci onamitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhāra pariyādāne pi na kassaci onamitabba
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should not bow down to anyone when his requisites of robes, almsfood, resting place, and medicinal requisites are exhausted.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa catutthaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja sīhassa catuttham aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the fourth quality of the lion that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sīho sapadānabhakkho yasmiṁ okāse nipatati, tattheva yāvadatthaṁ bhakkhayati, na varamaṁsaṁ vicināti;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sīhaḥ sa padāna bhakkhaḥ yasmin okāse nipatati tattha iva yāvadattham bhakkhayati na vara masam vicināti
translated: “And again, sire, the lion eats as much as he can hold in his mouth, he does not pick and choose among the morsels;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena sapadānabhakkhena bhavitabbaṁ, na kulāni
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena sa padāna bhakkhena na kulāni
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should eat as much as he can hold in his mouth, he should not pick and choose among the families

original: vicinitabbāni, na pubbagehaṁ hitvā kulāni upasaṅkamitabbāni, na bhojanaṁ vicinitabbaṁ,
analyzed: vicinitabbāni na pubbageham hitvā kulāni upasaṅkamitabbāni na bhojanam
translated: he visits, he should not go to families after abandoning his former ones, he should not pick and choose among the foods he eats.

original: yasmiṁ okāse kabaḷaṁ ādīyati, tasmiṁyeva okāse bhuñjitabbaṁ sarīrayāpanatthaṁ, na🔽varabhojanaṁ vicinitabbaṁ.
analyzed: yasmin okāse kabaḷam ādīyati tasmin eva okāse bhuñjitabbam na  vara bhojanam
translated: and one should not seek out choice food.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa pañcamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja sīhassa pañcamam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the fifth quality of the lion that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sīho asannidhibhakkho, sakiṁ gocaraṁ bhakkhayitvā na puna taṁ upagacchati;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sīhaḥ a sannidhi bhakkhaḥ sakim gocaram bhakkhayitvā na puna tam upagacchati
translated: “And again, sire, the lion eats his food without keeping it in store, and having eaten he does not go back to it again;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena asannidhikāraparibhoginā bhavitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva khalu mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena asannidhi kāra paribhoginā
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should be one who uses what he has stored up.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa chaṭṭhaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja sīhassa chaṭṭham aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the sixth quality of the lion that must be adopted.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, sīho bhojanaṁ aladdhā na paritassati, laddhāpi bhojanaṁ agadhito amucchito anajjhosanno paribhuñjati;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja sīhaḥ bhojanam a laddhā na paritassati laddhā api bhojanam agadhitaḥ amucchitaḥ an ajjhosannaḥ paribhuñjati
translated: “And again, sire, the lion, not being anxious if he does not get food, when he gets food eats it without greed, without being obsessed, without being enslaved, without being tied to it;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena bhojanaṁ aladdhā na paritassitabbaṁ, laddhāpi
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena bhojanam a laddhā na laddhā api
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training, not being anxious if he does not get food, when he gets food should eat it

original: bhojanaṁ agadhitena amucchitena anajjhosannena ādīnavadassāvinā nissaraṇapaññena paribhuñjitabbaṁ.🔽Idaṁ, mahārāja, sīhassa sattamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: bhojanam agadhitena amucchitena an ajjhosannena ādīnava dassāvinā nissaraṇa paññena paribhuñjitabba  idam mahā rāja sīhassa sattamam aṅgam
translated: He should eat his food without being greedy, without being greedy, without being greedy, seeing the danger in it, understanding the escape from it.🔽This, sire, is the seventh quality of the lion which you should adopt.

original: Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā devātidevena saṁyuttanikāyavare theraṁ mahākassapaṁ parikittayamānena—
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā devātidevena sayutta nikāya vare theram mahākassapam parikittayamānena
translated: He should eat his food without being tied to it, without being infatuated with it, not sensual enjoyment, not for sport, not for plumpness, but only for the endurance and continuance of this body, for ending discomfort, and for assisting the holy life, considering: ‘Thus I shall terminate old feelings without arousing new feelings and I shall be healthy and blameless and shall live in comfort.’

original: ‘Santuṭṭhoyaṁ, bhikkhave, kassapo itarītarena piṇḍapātena, itarītarapiṇḍapātasantuṭṭhiyā🔽ca vaṇṇavādī, na ca piṇḍapātahetu anesanaṁ appatirūpaṁ āpajjati, aladdhā ca piṇḍapātaṁ🔽na paritassati, laddhā ca piṇḍapātaṁ agadhito amucchito anajjhosanno ādīnavadassāvī🔽nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjatī’”ti.🔽Sīhaṅgapañho paṭhamo.
analyzed: santuṭṭhaḥ ya bhikkhave kassapaḥ itarītarena piṇḍapātena itarītara piṇḍapāta santuṭṭhiyā 🔽ca vaṇṇa vādī na ca piṇḍapāta hetu anesanam appatirūpam āpajjati aladdhā ca piṇḍapāta 🔽na paritassati laddhā ca piṇḍapātam a gadhitaḥ a mucchitaḥ an ajjhosannaḥ ādīnava dassāvī 🔽nissaraṇa paññaḥ paribhuñjati iti 🔽sīhaṅga pañho paṭhamo
translated: “This, sire, is the seventh quality of the lion that must be adopted.
